messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] RV'ing  was:  S.C. Conference SUITES FILLED!!!!!
messages.msgSnippet: Jennifer, A few summers ago, when I was visiting there in Houston, my mom, myself and my 2 children rented an RV for about a week. The kids didn t wear
messages.messageBody:
Jennifer,

A few summers ago, when I was visiting there in Houston, my mom, myself and my 2 children rented an RV for about a week. The kids didn't wear seatbelts. They mostly sat at the table playing cards or games. We didn't travel as far as you would be. If I remember correctly it cost around $1200 for the week. I don't know if that is good or bad but we had fun. I was a little nervous driving it but I got used to it.

Dina



Has anyone ever rented an RV? We are looking into it as an option for our
SC trip. I have so many questions, but most important: what do you do with
the kids? Are there seatbelts? Can/should they sleep in the beds while
driving? What about when they are awake?

I'm a little freaky about seatbelts being worn and having the little ones in
carseats. So I wonder if this is a good idea??

Thanks!
Jennifer
